resources.string: I'm passionate about tech and focused on Android app development.
I am a passionate software developer with a focus on Android app development. Here, you can explore my skills, projects, and achievements.
I have a diverse skill set in software development, including expertise in various programming languages, frameworks, and tools. My focus is on creating efficient and user-friendly applications.
I have worked on a variety of projects, ranging from mobile applications to web development. Each project showcases my ability to solve complex problems and deliver high-quality software solutions.

With experience in both commercial and academic projects, I have honed my skills in software engineering, project management, and teamwork. I am committed to continuous learning and professional growth.
I hold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from Jagiellonian University, where I gained a solid foundation in programming, algorithms, and software development methodologies.
Connect with me on social media to stay updated on my latest projects, achievements, and insights into the world of software development.
I have received several awards and recognitions for my contributions to software development and education. These achievements reflect my dedication to excellence and my passion for technology.
A collection of my programming languages, frameworks, and other technical skills.
A collection of my programming projects, showcasing my skills and experience in software development.
Application for managing tournaments with a custom algorithm

This tournament management application was developed on commission to facilitate competitive match play according to a client-specific algorithm. The app provides a user-friendly interface for entering match results, automatically pairs teams for the next round based on the algorithm, calculates points, and generates comprehensive PDF summaries of the tournament's progress. Additionally, it creates graphs to visually represent the algorithm's logic and outcomes. The application is translated into four languages using Python's gettext module, ensuring accessibility for a diverse user base. This project showcases my ability to deliver tailored, multilingual software solutions that meet specific client requirements and enhance the management of complex tournament structures.
Valorant Lineups is a mobile app for Valorant players that helps them during gameplay

Valorant Lineups is a mobile app created for Valorant players to assist them during gameplay. The app offers a wide collection of lineups, allowing players to execute advanced techniques without the need to memorize specific settings on the map. With this app, players can achieve better results in the game and climb higher ranks. It was the first app of its kind for Valorant available on the Play Store, achieving success with over 100,000 downloads. This project highlights my skills in delivering innovative and effective solutions.
Set of 2 applications - a creator and an interpreter of text-based games

Demiurg is an application developed as part of a Software Engineering course, created by a team of five people. The project consists of two separate applications: a game creator and an interpreter for text-based games. The creator allows users to design complex game worlds with mechanics such as non-linear quests. It enables the creation of detailed interactive narratives, while the interpreter provides an immersive experience during gameplay. This project demonstrates my ability to work in a team and create independent yet cooperating programs.
DayMath is an educational application for Polish students, featuring math quizzes, explanations, and animations.

An educational application that aims to enhance math learning through a variety of interactive features, including math quizzes, detailed text explanations of various topics, and animations that visualize and explain complex problems. These tools work together to provide an engaging and effective educational experience. It is my most advanced project, combining multiple technologies. The app itself is built in Kotlin, but the task texts required the use of LaTeX, which is well-supported in Python. The app also connects to Firebase, where users' learning progress is saved. This project highlights my commitment to developing my tutoring business and combines my skills in computer science, mathematics, education, and linguistics.
Desktop app recommending movies based on user ratings

The Movie Recommendation System is a desktop application created in collaboration with a colleague as part of a Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence course. This app enables users to rate movies they have watched, and employs AI algorithms to recommend new movies tailored to their preferences. By analyzing user ratings and employing sophisticated recommendation techniques, the system provides personalized movie suggestions, enhancing the user’s viewing experience. This project highlights our practical application of AI principles and our ability to develop user-centric, intelligent software solutions.
Application generating room number and name plates

This application was created in collaboration with a colleague for a programming course in C#. It generates room number and name plates that can be printed and hung next to room doors. The application allows users to choose the font, logo, and text color. It also enables saving the project between sessions.
Application for generating lesson schedules integrated with Discord.

This application was created to facilitate the organization of my tutoring sessions. It allows me to easily add new lessons to the schedule. The application is integrated with Discord, enabling me to automatically send notifications about new lessons to my server. It also automatically retrieves the current day of the year and generates a schedule for the upcoming week, allowing the user to set the starting day (e.g., today or tomorrow). It also allows:
-setting the start and end time
-choosing a theme
-classifying individual lessons (exercises, lectures, tutoring sessions (remote or in-person), one-time events, etc.)
-listing dates.
Binary clock made using Compose Multiplatform
Binary clock made using Compose Multiplatform
Simple script allowing to shift subtitles in .srt files

Simple script allowing to shift subtitles in .srt files. It was created for my individual need to shift subtitles that did not match the movie version (were delayed by a few seconds forward or backward).
Multithreaded script allowing to download songs from YouTube

This application allows you to download a playlist from Spotify, via YouTube. It requires the user to export the playlist to a .csv file using the Exportify application, and then downloads the songs from YouTube in separate threads, searching for them by name and artist, and saving them in an organized way - creating folders with artists, and naming each song with its title.
Simple Tic-Tac-Toe game that can be played with a friend on Discord
Simple Tic-Tac-Toe game that can be played with a friend on Discord
App tracking cryptocurrency prices. It allows adding cryptocurrencies to track, and displays their current prices along with a chart of changes over the last 24 hours.

This website was developed by me to showcase my tutoring offer in mathematics and computer science. It contains all the details regarding lessons, rates, reviews, and contact information. The site was built entirely using Jetpack Compose.
Mobile remote control for computer media player

This project consists of two applications - a client and a server, which are useful for watching movies. The server application runs on the computer, while the client runs on the phone. This allows you to control movie playback from your phone, such as pausing, fast-forwarding or rewinding, adjusting volume, and muting sound, while being away from the computer.
Classic mobile app that allows you to save your todos
Classic mobile app that allows you to save your todos. It enables creating, editing, and deleting tasks. Tasks have their own priority and completion date. Everything is saved offline on the device.
Application facilitating my work on the Valorant Lineups app

This application facilitates my work on the Valorant Lineups app. It allows for quick saving of in-game screenshots in folders, according to my own data structure for this app. It has a list of skills for each agent, a map index, and types of screenshots.
My portfolio website, which you are currently browsing. I created it solely using Kobweb.
Application for counting days between dates

Application for counting days between dates. It can be run as a mobile app on Android, desktop, or web. It allows users to save any number of date pairs, between which it calculates: the number of days that have passed, and the number of days remaining.
Client and server for Tic-Tac-Toe game over a local network

Client and server for Tic-Tac-Toe game over a local network. The client can be run as a desktop, web, or mobile app on Android. Created using sockets. It provides type-safe message handling and verification.

Application facilitating remote math tutoring. It draws necessary objects such as tables, coordinate systems, chessboards, solids (pyramids and prisms with various bases). It allows for easy copying to the clipboard with a transparent background, enabling direct pasting into any graphic program used for tutoring.
Application for practicing reading function properties from graphs

Application for practicing reading function properties from graphs. Created for high school graduates. It allows for effective learning of tasks in this topic, thoroughly preparing for the graduation exam. The app generates graphs, allows inputting answers, checks them, and provides correct solutions. Answers are always simplified to the simplest form, even in the case of piecewise functions.
An app for preparing a game session in the paper version of Calico
An app for preparing a game session in the paper version of Calico. The user can draw cats, patterns, and projects depending on the number of players. The app was created for personal use
A website with high school final exam tasks grouped by topics and subcategories

A website with high school final exam tasks grouped by topics and subcategories. Created with my students in mind. It also streamlines my tutoring sessions. Beyond the features available on other sites of this type, I added categorization of tasks based on their frequency on the exam – from guaranteed exam questions to non-standard tasks – so that students preparing for the exam know which tasks to focus on. Additionally, each task has a copy-to-clipboard button, allowing me to quickly copy and paste any task into the graphics program used during tutoring.
A collection of my professional experience, including tutoring and app development.
Preparing students for high school graduation and eighth-grade exams
Creating learning materials using LaTeX and Manim
Creating my own mobile applications for Android
Developing applications based on user needs
A collection of my education, including my Bachelor's degree and high school.
Certificate: CCNA Routing and Switching: Introduction to Networks
Certificate: PCAP: Programming Essentials in Python
Certificate: Introduction to the Internet of Everything
Certificate: CPA: Programming Essentials in C++
A collection of my achievements, including awards and recognitions in various contests.

1st Place in the School Programming Contest

2nd Place in the School English Contest
Honorable Mention in the International Math Contest "Kangur Matematyczny"
Connect with me on social media to watch all my educational animations.
